metadata.description: Lightweight idiom localization rules - trusts Gemini's zero-shot knowledge, provides activation conditions
metadata.philosophy: Let Gemini decide HOW to localize, we decide WHEN to localize

activation_rules.description: Conditions that trigger idiom localization vs preservation

gyaru.rationale: Casual, contemporary speech - always localize for natural flow
examples: やっぱり → Of course (not 'As expected')
仕方がない → Whatever / Can't help it (not 'It can't be helped')

tsundere.rationale: Defensive, dismissive tone - localize for punch
examples: うるさい → Shut up / Whatever (not 'You're noisy')
別に → Not like I care / Whatever (not 'Not particularly')
すごい → Amazing / Awesome (not 'Incredible')
やった → Yes! / Score! (not 'I did it')
そうか → I see (minimal)
なるほど → Indeed / I understand (formal acceptable)

ojou_sama.rationale: Formal, refined speech - slight preservation bias
examples: ごきげんよう → Good day (not 'How do you do')
恐れ入ります → Pardon me (formal but natural)
あの → Um... / Uh... (natural hesitation)
ごめんなさい → Sorry / I'm sorry (simple)

yandere.rationale: Intense emotions - localize for dramatic impact
examples: 許さない → I won't forgive you / You're done (threatening)
愛してる → I love you (direct, intense)

default_casual.rationale: Standard casual speech - lean toward localization
examples: まあ → Well / I guess
ちょっと → A bit / Kinda
そうですね → That's right / I see
申し訳ございません → My apologies / I apologize

context_multipliers.description: Scene context adjusts base archetype weight

comedic_scene.rationale: Comedy requires punchline clarity - boost localization

serious_scene.rationale: Serious moments preserve weight - reduce localization

romantic_scene.rationale: Romance needs natural flow - slight boost

introspective_monologue.rationale: Internal thought can be more literal

literacy_technique_triggers.description: Activate localization when literacy techniques apply

natural_dialogue_flow.rationale: Dialogue prioritizes natural speech over literal translation
natural_dialogue_flow.gemini_instruction: Translate this dialogue idiom to sound natural in casual English conversation. Prioritize how a native English speaker would express this feeling/reaction.

pseudo_particle_compatibility.rationale: Sentences with particles (よ、ね、な) should pair with localized idioms + pseudo-particles
pseudo_particle_compatibility.gemini_instruction: This sentence has a Japanese particle conveying tone. Localize the idiom AND add an appropriate English pseudo-particle (right?, seriously, you know, etc.) to match the tone.
examples: やっぱりだよね → Of course, right? (localized + pseudo-particle 'right?')
仕方がないな → Can't help it, I guess (localized + pseudo-particle 'I guess')

contraction_enforcement.rationale: Localized idioms pair naturally with contractions
contraction_enforcement.gemini_instruction: Use contracted forms (can't, won't, I'm) when localizing this idiom to match casual register.

show_dont_tell.rationale: Emotional idioms should be localized to show feeling vividly
show_dont_tell.gemini_instruction: Translate this emotional idiom to convey the FEELING, not literal words. How would an English speaker naturally express this emotion?
examples: 心臓が飛び出しそう → My heart's pounding out of my chest (not 'My heart feels like it will jump out')
頭が真っ白になる → My mind went blank (not 'My head became pure white')

common_idiom_patterns.description: Common patterns Gemini should recognize - guidance only, not exhaustive

examples: 久しぶり → Long time no see / Been a while
お疲れ様 → Good work / Thanks for your hard work
行ってきます → I'm off / Heading out
ただいま → I'm back / I'm home
time_expressions.guidance: Localize to natural English greetings - 'I'm off' not 'I'll go and come back'

examples: そうだね → Right / Yeah / That's true
なるほど → I see / Makes sense / Ah
やっぱり → Figures / Of course / Knew it
agreement_expressions.guidance: Use English discourse markers - 'Yeah' or 'Right', not 'That is so'

examples: 別に → Not really / Whatever / Not like I care
どうでもいい → Whatever / Don't care / Doesn't matter
うるさい → Shut up / Whatever / Quiet
dismissive_expressions.guidance: Match dismissive tone - 'Whatever' is more natural than 'It doesn't matter to me'

examples: えっ → What? / Huh? / Wait
マジで → Seriously? / For real? / No way
ウソ → No way / You're kidding / What?
surprise_reactions.guidance: Use natural English exclamations - 'No way' not 'That's a lie'

examples: 恥ずかしい → Embarrassing / So awkward / I'm mortified
やばい → Oh no / This is bad / Crap
どうしよう → What do I do? / Oh god / I'm screwed
embarrassment_expressions.guidance: Capture embarrassment naturally - 'So awkward' more natural than 'I feel embarrassed'

prompt_injection_template.description: Template for injecting localization rules into Gemini translation prompt

weight_interpretations.0.0_to_0.3: Preserve authenticity - use literal/formal translations when natural
weight_interpretations.0.3_to_0.5: Slight preservation bias - formal but still natural English
weight_interpretations.0.5_to_0.7: Balanced approach - localize common idioms, preserve unique ones
weight_interpretations.0.7_to_0.85: Strong localization - prioritize natural English speech
weight_interpretations.0.85_to_1.0: Maximum localization - always use natural English equivalents

how_to_use: 1. Detect character archetype from manifest or dialogue context
2. Look up base localization_weight from archetype_bias
3. Apply context_multipliers if scene keywords match
5. Inject final weight + instructions into Gemini prompt
6. Trust Gemini to translate idioms appropriately given the weight

example_calculation.scenario: Gyaru character in comedic scene with sentence-ending particle
example_calculation.result: Maximum localization - translate idiom naturally + add pseudo-particle
example_calculation.example: やっぱりだよね → Of course, right? (not 'As expected, it is')

gemini_trust_philosophy.rationale: Gemini 2.5 Pro has excellent zero-shot idiom knowledge from training. We don't need exhaustive idiom dictionaries. We need smart activation rules.
what_we_provide: WHY to localize (character personality, scene mood)
GUIDANCE on tone (formal vs casual, literal vs natural)
what_gemini_provides: HOW to translate each specific idiom
English equivalent that matches the weight/tone
advantages: Adapts to new idioms automatically (Gemini recognizes them)
Personal project friendly (easy to understand and modify)
